isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 15 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Prior to assembly, lubricate all O-rings (identify using Figure 17), seals, and pistons as well as body and cover bores, using the lubricant provided with the Bendix maintenance kit. Use all of the lubricant and spread it evenly on the rubbing surfaces.
Install the O-ring (Item 30) on the inlet valve seat (Item 31).
Install the small end of the inlet/exhaust valve spring (Item 33) over the rubber of the valve (Item 32), making sure the spring coils rest on the valves four tabs.
Insert the spring and valve into the valve seat (Item 31), making sure the four tabs are within the seat's bore.
Insert the valve, seat and spring assembly into the proportioning piston (Item 27), large end of the spring first.

While holding the inlet valve seat (Item 31) in place, install the retaining ring (Item 29) to secure it in the piston (Item 27). Make certain the retaining ring is fully seated in its groove. Make sure the valve is straight against the exhaust seat and free to move.
Install both the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 26 and 28) on the proportioning piston (Item 27).

Install both the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 24 and 25) on the blend back piston (Item 23), then insert the small diameter of the proportioning piston (Item 27) into the small diameter end of the blend back piston (Item 23).
Carefully insert the assembled proportioning and blend back pistons (Items 23 and 27) to the edge of the bore in the cover (Item 2). Do not cut or pinch the O-rings.

With the bore of the cover facing up, install the spring cage (Item 22) in the blend back piston (Item 23) so that the flat side rests against the blend back piston - depressed side out towards spring (Item 21).
Install the O-ring (Item 20) on the service piston (Item 19), then install the spring (Item 21) in the cage (Item 22) so that its coils are within the I.D. of the cage.
Install O-ring (Item 17) on exhaust piston (Item 16), and place exhaust diaphragm (Item 18) between the six posts of the service piston (Item 19).

Place exhaust piston on service piston with the six ribbed side facing the service piston. Then install both pistons while pushing the proportioning and blend back pistons (Items 27 and 23) all the way into the cover.
Install the dust shield (Item 15) in the cover (Item 2).
While holding the dust shield (Item 15) in the cover (Item 2), install the retaining ring (Item 14), making certain it is fully seated in its groove.
Install the exhaust cover (Item 36) using screw (Item 35) to retain it. Tighten the screw to 8 to 15 in-lbs. (.9 to 1.6 N•m).

Install the valve retainer (Item 8) on the inlet and exhaust valve (Item 9) so that the flange of the retainer (Item 8) surrounds the rubber portion of the valve. Install the inlet and exhaust valve in the body (Item 1).
Install the inlet and exhaust valve return spring (Item 7) in the body (Item 1).

Install the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 5 and 6) in the exhaust cover (Item 4), then install the exhaust cover in the body (Item 1), taking care not to damage the O-rings. Hold the exhaust cover in place.
While depressing the exhaust cover (Item 4), install the retaining ring (Item 3) in the body (Item 1). Make sure that the retainer (Item 8) is fully seated in the groove in the body.
Using lubricant to hold them in place, install the large and small sealing rings (Items 11 and 34) on the cover (Item 2).
Install the O-ring (Item 13) on the relay piston (Item 12), then install the piston in the body (Item 1).

After noting the relationship marks made prior to disassembly, install the mounting bracket (not illustrated) on the cover (Item 2), then secure the cover (Item 2) and mounting bracket on the body (Item 1) using the four capscrews (Item 10). Tighten the four screws to 120 to 150 in-lbs. (13.6 to 16.9 N•m).
Install all air line fittings and plugs, making certain thread sealing material does not enter the valve.
Install the BP-R1 on the vehicle and perform the , OPERATION AND LEAKAGE, TEST (see SERVICE CHECK ) before returning the vehicle to service.
